content:
For the example here: http://csclub.uwaterloo.ca/~a52arora/path-with-array-access.rs, why do we not get index projection? I'm assuming since it's an array the compiler doesn't see it as a call to a function but rather an index operation.

http://csclub.uwaterloo.ca/~a52arora/path-with-array-access.out, bottom should have what we capture (this just the use-analysis i.e. without min analysis) You can also search for "upvar borrow" to see what the delegate was called with.

I the case where the closure had println!("{}", node2.neightbours[0]) I see the deref being followed by a Field projection to access neightbours but not index still
